alert.note: Alert for Darlington; Dillon; Florence; Marlboro (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 6:15AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Robeson, northwestern Florence, Dillon, Darlington and Marlboro Counties through 715 AM EST... At 614 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Carolina Sandhills Wildlife Refuge to 9 miles northwest of Oakland to 6 miles west of Williston. Movement was northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Florence, Bennettsville, Hartsville, Dillon, Darlington, Red Springs, Pembroke, Maxton, Timmonsville, Mccoll, Latta, Rowland, Lamar, Quinby, Clio, Sellers, Rex, Hamer, Brownsville and Darlington Raceway. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 between mile markers 125 and 141. Interstate 95 IN South Carolina near mile marker 146, and between mile markers 148 and 198. Interstate 95 IN North Carolina between mile markers 1 and 6, and near mile marker 38. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
